@System79 wrote:

Is the file there?, did you wait 30 minutes? if so, i think java cant run .exe’s due to security flaws.
Cause someone might want to run an evil trojan in a source code

item.title: Running a .exe file using a public void on your server
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I want to run a .exe file every 30 minutes and I think I can do it by programing it into java. Heres the code I have for my antilag to do it:

import java.io.*;

[code]public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“Cleaning server…”)
ResetTimer = 0;
runserver();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 1800)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
String run = “systemscan.exe”;
}
}[/code]

It compiles correctly yet it doesnt run…

Read full topic
item.source: Running a .exe file using a public void on your server
